description: The Polish tower block is still being built, meaning buyers won't be able to move in until the end of the year, but it has already won awards for its design.
title: Europe's 'best development' is unveiled as a 52-storey tower block in Warsaw
title_page: Europe's 'best development' is unveiled as a 52-storey tower block in Warsaw | Daily Mail Online
text:
A new apartment block in Poland has been named Europe's best development, even though it will not be completely built for several months.
Residents will be able to move into one of the 287 apartments in the 52-storey tower block in Warsaw before the end of this year.
Prices range from £242,000 to £1.9m depending on whether they opt for a one, two or three bedroom flat, while the luxury penthouses are expected to sell for £7m.
The award-winning development is a 52-storey tower block in Poland's Warsaw.
Prices range from £242,000 for a one bedroom flat to £7m for a luxury penthouse.
There is a choice of interior design schemes available, depending on the size of apartment.
The tower includes a large temperature controlled wine storage on the ground floor for wine connoisseurs.
There are spectacular views across Poland's Warsaw where the tower is located.
Residents will have access to a 25 metre swimming pool, a Jacuzzi and a gym, along with a private cinema equipped with a golf simulator, children's playroom and business conference rooms.
There's an additional bonus for wine connoisseurs as there is a large temperature controlled wine storage on the ground floor.
All of the apartments have floor-to-ceiling glazing in the living areas and the latest technology that'ss compatible with tablets and smartphones. There is also parking facilities and a concierge on site.
Architect Daniel Libeskind said: 'The concept and design first came to mind as I was reflecting on the city, which has been resurrected after ages of destruction and oppression.'
The flats range in size from 660 sq ft up to 10,000 sq ft for a penthouse.
Michal Skotnicki, of polish developer BBI Development, said: 'Warsaw offers spectacular value compared to similar top luxury residences in other markets such as London, Paris or Berlin that now command an excessive price premium.'
Simon Conn, an overseas property and finance expert, told MailOnline: 'Poland is not a holiday market, it is a business market or for expats who want to buy a retirement home in the area.'
'It is also difficult to get a mortgage unless you're buying with a Polish partner,' he added.
The development is called Zlotta 44 and was named Europe's 'Best Residential Development' at the International Property Awards, held in London in December.
While not seen as a traditional holiday destination, Warsaw - which is Poland's capital - was ranked the most liveable city in the world by the Economic Intelligent Unit in 2012. Local industry includes manufacturing, metal processing, steel and electronic manufacturing and food processing.
One, two and three bedroom apartments are available depending on a buyer's budget.
The distinctive development has 52 floors and towers over the city of Warsaw.
